conclusion: Car A drives in from the group of blocks on the right, and the task is to determine which blocks it collides with and where it eventually stops based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
The image shows a green surface with a cluster of colored blocks (blue, purple, orange, yellow, green, and red) and a car labeled A approaching from the right.
Car A’s right-to-left motion makes its first impact on the bright-blue block that sits highest in the loose ring of cubes.
The blue block is knocked forward and slightly inward, while A’s nose is deflected a little upward (north-west on the picture).
Because of the deflection, A now clips the purple block that was behind the blue one.
The purple block topples backward; the collision slows A appreciably and straightens its heading so it now moves almost directly leftward toward the yellow cube.
Car A, still with some residual speed, runs into the yellow cube.
The yellow cube shoots left-downward, while A loses almost all of its remaining kinetic energy and pivots slightly clockwise.
By the time it rolls clear of the yellow block, A is moving so slowly that it never reaches the green, orange, or red cubes lying farther down-range.
Friction with the cloth brings A to rest just below (south of) the yellow cube’s original position, still among the cluster’s upper left edge.
Cubes struck: blue → purple → yellow (in that order).
Stopping place: the car comes to rest a little left of the yellow cube’s starting spot, inside the cluster’s upper left corner.
